fields.Title of Contribution: Complexity in practice: implications for urban  sustainability and governance in the Anthropocene
fields.Description/Abstract: The path towards the long-term prosperity of our species passes through the sustain-<br>ability of urban environments. A transition to sustainability has to take place within<br>socioecological complex adaptive systems. Thus, urban sustainability processes in the<br>21st century require that we seriously consider the relevance of a complex adaptive sys-<br>tems approach. This paper offers a new roadmap for urban sustainability governance<br>practitioners. Firstly, we attempt to clarify how complexity science can have practical<br>relevance sustainability policies through our understanding of emergent phenomena and<br>employ a small-N comparative analysis of case studies. Secondly, we discuss various<br>challenges that complexity places on practice, focusing on the concepts of predictive ca-<br>pacity, causal explanation, the unconscious mind and the erosion of moral sentiments;<br>we synthesize these ideas by provide a set of guidelines for a sophisticated practitioner.
